page.title: 17Schoolday in Watford. (1)
page.content: This is a typical school day-a Thursday I live in a detached house near the school. There are few detached houses in this area. Apart from 2 children in my class all live in semi-detached or terraced houses. Most houses were built at the beginning of this century but mine was built in 1952. During the war a flying bomb fell on many houses in my road. 22 houses were destroyed, mostly terraced ones. My house and the one next door replaced the 3 terraced ones which were bombed. I awake at 7.30am and get dressed. In our school we do not have to wear school uniform. About a third of the 201 children wear it. I choose to wear school uniform in the winter but lighter summer clothes. I still have sheets and blankets on my bed. I wish I had a duvet instead as my bed would be easier to make. Half my friends have duvets. They are luckier.
